div.class: inner col col24 first last id0ae1c70a-9249-42e2-b9e3-28cec2670718

div.h2: 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Cases in Whatcom County

strong.em: These numbers are updated daily at 12:00 pm. They are updated sooner if significant developments occur.Â

div.p: Subscribe to receive an email or text message notification when we update COVID-19 case results, along with other news items from WCHD. To sign up, go to our subscription sign up page, and select Health â€“ Public Health News under the News Flash section.

div.em: ** Confirmed Cases:Â Positive test results for Whatcom County residents reported in the Washington Disease Reporting System as of 11:59 pm the previous day.

p.em: *Negative Results:Â Negative test results available for individuals that are known to the Whatcom County Health Department in the Washington Disease Reporting System as of 11:59 pm the previous day.

h4.a: Whatcom County COVID-19 Update for April 21, 2020

li.div: On April 21, 2020, the Whatcom County Health Department is reporting two (2) new confirmed case of COVID-19. The total number of confirmed cases is now 280 and the number of associated deaths remains at 27. Learn More

h4.a: Whatcom County COVID-19 Update for April 20, 2020

li.div: On April 20, 2020, the Whatcom County Health Department is reporting one (1) new confirmed case of COVID-19 and one (1) new death. The total number of confirmed cases is 278 and the total number of associated deaths is 27. Learn More

Many of us donâ€™t have experience teleworking or teaching our children from home. Weâ€™re facing challenges trying to help our children adjust to distance learning while weâ€™re also adjusting to remote work routines. Having patience is especially important Read more
